website_summaries.verdict: This model serves as both a bottle jack and a jack stand.
pros: Small enough to keep in your car for emergencies
Jack stand built in to add a level of security to your job
Good for a truck or jeep
Lifts a little taller than other jacks, up to 21 inches
cons: This bottle jack seems to be a little more difficult to master than others on the market

customer_reviews.title: Product shipped with defected hydraulic part
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this jack months ago for emergency use. I had a flat tire and had a chance to use it yesterday. To my surprise, the Powerbuilt Jack could only jack up my car for a few inches (less than 5 inches) because the hydraulic jack could not hold up pressure. When I reached out for the instruction booklet, I found that the box was filled with oil (see photo). It is a clear indication that the product was shipped with a leaked hydraulic jack. I am disappointed and expect the product to last at least one emergency use.
customer_reviews.author: Muku

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: Wish I had taken more time to read the reviews before purchasing. Did not use until a month after purchasing and was defective. Can't return and it looks to be a common flaw with the design. Would recommend looking at another brand.
customer_reviews.author: Stacy

customer_reviews.title: Terrible product.  Should have bought a $10 bottle jack over this overpriced piece of garbage.
customer_reviews.text: The jack gets stuck half way up all the time (used it twice and did it both times), It literally won't go down all the way, so it is just cumbersome and worthless. If you want a very bad jack that gets stuck, is cumbersome, and has terrible warranty support. You have found the right jack.
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Read the directions THOROUGHLY before giving this a bad review... 😊
customer_reviews.text: I have been using my TWO for YEARS now and it still works great! I see on other reviews where customers gave it a very bad rating. It was there own fault that it wasn't working correctly! They were not lifting up up the release lever before bring the jack back down. Like my grandfather always told me when I was ten, " If All Else Fails Read The Freaking Directions... That has been good advice going on 51 years now! 😁🙌🙋
customer_reviews.author: G. Jones  Phx. Az. 😷

customer_reviews.title: Great idea but poor quality
customer_reviews.text: I love and a hate this product. It worked great to lift my Jeep Wrangler and the jack stand part worked well too. The problem is that it was leaking oil all over the place. There was a lot of oil on the box when it came but I thought that could have something to do with being placed on its side. So I cleaned it all up and tried it out. It did work well but it losing alot of oil. A brand new jack should not leak like this.
customer_reviews.author: Jeep Owner

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered two of these the other day. Great quality, built tough and get the job done. I loved them so much I bought two more which came in today.... one was another black 3ton all-in-one jack, the other was a grey 6k lbs all-in-one jack. The grey one is by far better, it has a lever only 2/3 the length of the normal 3ton ones (which I prefer since it doesn't stick out as far), it has five extra adjustable height holes instead of three and it's all round slimmer and slicker.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory

customer_reviews.title: 54 Dollar POS!!!
customer_reviews.text: Opened the box and set the jack down in my truck box ..... a week or so later I go to pull it out and use it .... guess what? This thing pissed every drop of the hydraulic fluid all over the bottom of truck box. All over my tools and everything!!! It hasn't been used at all and it's seeping out of the main seal. Absolute GARBAGE!! Buy from somebody else and you'll be much happier.
customer_reviews.author: Brad W.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my leveled Tundra
customer_reviews.text: I wanted this to carry in my truck since it is leveled with bigger tires than stock. Original bottle jack sucks and not tall enough. I was worried this would not get the truck lifted enough to change out a tire. I was wrong, it had enough lift to do the job and the lock was a nice added feature. Pretty sturdy too, wouldnt be worried about truck falling over like the stock jack felt. I keep a small block of 4x4 wood to give it a bit more lift to ease some of the jacking pains lol.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive alternative to a high lift floor jack
customer_reviews.text: This is an extremely affordable alternative to a high lift floor jack for vehicles with taller ground clearances. It also solves for a conundrum we all face when working without a full lift: how to raise the vehicle and safely set it on a jackstand so you can work under it. Do you lift from a less ideal point so your jackstand is at the manufacturer recommended contact point? Or do you lift there and set the jackstand elsewhere? This lifts and supports the vehicle with a jackstand right where the manufacturer intended. That all said, I got two good copies. I recommend reading the other reviews here as well.
customer_reviews.author: LividSquirrel

customer_reviews.title: Great idea
customer_reviews.text: Ok I'm taking a chance on doing a review. I bought this 'IN CASE' I need it. I haven't tried it yet, but purchased after returning a floor jack to Harbor Freight (that would not release and go down.) I like the old style jacks better, not the release in the handle types. It's annoying to lift a truck and it doesn't come down! One thing I would like better is if this jack had a rotating pump, rather than an up and down pump lift. The jack that came in my pickup has a rotating long handle which is much easier.
customer_reviews.author: Pat

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: Very overpriced. I bought this for my 12 year old sons first truck that he just bought with his own money. We are overhauling it and it didn't have a jack so I thought this would be much safer than a scissor jack. When lowering the jack, like most Jack's, you release the hydraulic pressure with a twist but this jack in particular will not decompress unless there is significant weight on it. The only way I can get it to go down after loosening the pressure is to step on it with all 260 lbs of me. I hope that if he ever has to use it that it doesn't get stuck under the frame.
customer_reviews.author: David Laws

customer_reviews.title: Hi lift for Jeeps and others, large base for safer stance
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for taking a lifted Jeep off-road. Sadly I got ot use it on my Wife's when she slid into a sharp rock and punctured the sidewall. Jack performed flawlessly lifting the axle quickly and securely off the ground and holding it rock solid while the tire was changed. The only thing I'd want to change is the cheapo two piece jack handle.
customer_reviews.author: David C. Logothetis

customer_reviews.title: Strong, sturdy jack
customer_reviews.text: Very strong, and very easy to use. The addition of the built-in base makes it fantastically portable. I keep it in my SUV for roadside emergencies. If you intend to do the same, remember to pull it out on occasion and test it to ensure that the seals are still good. Bottle jacks are more complex machines than scissor lifts, and while that complexity generally yields greater capacity and efficiency, it also yields more points of possible breakage (namely, those pesky seals). Great jack!
customer_reviews.author: SA7

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product
customer_reviews.text: Like these a lot! Exactly as advertised and very easy to use. Lifts my K1500 no problems and having the peace of mind that the jack locks as well is great. Bought two. Highly recommend Update: Still a great jack but be prepared for it to occasionally get stuck awkwardly after you’re finished and lowering the vehicle back to the ground. Did a pretty big project this weekend and had to use my roller jack to lift it off the other to be able to slide it out. Still think it’s great and felt very safe doing the work.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel J Pollock

customer_reviews.title: These work great!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these to help stabilize my RV Travel Trailer when parked/camping. I put them near the axles on the frame. They work great for this purpose. They serve so many other functions though. I can now change a tire on the trailer with ease with this jack. the wide stable base makes it so much safer. I also have been using these in my garage. These work great on unibody cars/trucks because you do not need an additional jack stand. Always difficult to place a floor jack and a stand. This takes care of that problem. Very pleased with the two units I purchased.
customer_reviews.author: John Hostinsky III

customer_reviews.title: Do you value your life?
customer_reviews.text: Unless your working on small itty bitty cars like a fiat or Mini Cooper DO NOT BUY THIS PRODUCT I lifted up my vehicle and it came crashing down almost smashed me in the process
customer_reviews.author: Operating in the grey area

customer_reviews.title: Check operation as soon as you get it.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use on my Jeep instead of a hi lift. The first one I received did not work. It would not lift the Jeep. I checked that the bleed valve was closed and check the oil level. Both were fine so it looks like bad seals. I returned it and ordered a replacement. The second one works great, so far. I tested it by jacking up one of the wheels on the Jeep a couple of times. Since there seems to be so many failures I’m going to test this one several more times before the 30 day return is over.
customer_reviews.author: timw

customer_reviews.title: One of the Best purchases I have ever made
customer_reviews.text: I have never fully trusted plain jack stands because of the small 4 contact points that are L-Shaped, I have seen them go through soft assault (not knowing it was soft). The base on this is a full square and creates a more stable support, some of the best features is that it is also a hydraulic jack and a extendable jack stand with safety latches as it rises. It just feels more sturdy then a plain jack stand. So, three products in one. Great...worth the price. I bought 2 and it perfect for just about everything.
customer_reviews.author: whpooh

customer_reviews.title: Works great! (If your car is tall enough)
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these because it was overall cheaper than a jack and 2 stands. I love these and they work great. However, if your car is on the lower side, these will probably not work for you. I have a 2016 Honda HRV with bigger tires (more ground clearance) and they don't fit under. I got two pieces of 2x4 and made a little ramp and those raised the car enough for me to get the lifts under my car. Overall, I love the product and how well it's made, very easy to use and makes life easier. I do recommend this product, just make sure it will work for you.
customer_reviews.author: Regardt

customer_reviews.title: One out of two isn't good enough
customer_reviews.text: If they had both worked properly I would have given five stars but after testing them out with no problems I used them to rotate my tires and one worked perfectly and one the lock release got stuck and wouldn't release, thankfully I had two and the other one was working so i had to use that to jack the truck up so I could slide out the stuck jack. I then had to hit the release pin very hard to get it down and it continues to stick and the best part is by the time I used them the return period had just expired so now I'm stuck in more than one way.
customer_reviews.author: D. Whitaker

customer_reviews.title: have to jack it up  first before I can use it with another Jack
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this Car jacks and thought this is all I needed I have a 2012 Dodge Caravan the only problem is it doesn't fit under the car I have to jack it up first before I can use it with another Jack it's a great idea they should make one a little smaller for lowered vehicles, I still use it as I said I have to jack it up for us with another Jack
customer_reviews.author: Jim Denice

customer_reviews.title: Great product and top quality. Do not pay attention to a few negative reviews.
customer_reviews.text: I looked at this Jack last year and should have purchased at the lower price. I did not because of a few bad reviews. I used it today and this is a great product and well made. I returned a jack to Harbor freight for very poor quality and took a chance on this. Works as expected. I did have a problem with jack losing height at the top of the lift but lowered it and raised the adjustable jack stand higher and works great.
customer_reviews.author: Chuck H.

customer_reviews.title: Bad business
customer_reviews.text: Box was banged up and inside was missing a snap ring. I had to buy one. Plus I smashed my finger fixing the piece that was missing. Bad business
customer_reviews.author: James S.

customer_reviews.title: I opened the box, I noticed a wet spot ...
customer_reviews.text: I opened the box, I noticed a wet spot on the floor; it was the jack leaking oil everywhere. Not safe to use it leaking. Returned. Tks.
customer_reviews.author: Jota

customer_reviews.title: Like the locking mechanism and the lift. I can now use my BMW assigned lifting slot.
customer_reviews.text: Used this 3ton jack on 2011 BMW X5 50i 5380 lbs Read the height of the jack wrong as min 8.6 inches. This 3ton is min 11inchs. Since I wanted the 3ton capacity I lifted the suv with my old floor jack from the front passenger side to a level where this jack fit in the rear passenger bmw lifting slot/bracket. Then lowered my floor jack and raised this jack to change my rear brakes one side at a time.
customer_reviews.author: Caliguy

customer_reviews.title: great idea with 1 major drawback.
customer_reviews.text: I was really excited about this jack. I thought it was a great idea to combine a kick stand and jack together. When I tried to use it I immediately found a major draw back... I was trying to change the brake pads and rotors on my subaru forester. The problem is that even on the lowest setting, I still had to use the jack that came with the car to lift the vehicle up a few inches so I could use this Powerbuilt Jack (it's just too tall... probably ok for a pickup truck but not a sedan). I still used the jack because it was much safer than relying on the flimsy jack that came with the car.
customer_reviews.author: RAMBO

customer_reviews.title: Failed second time I used it
customer_reviews.text: I had seen several reviews about the jack not returning to the closed position but I ordered one and sure enough the first time I used it the jack would not lower to the closed position and I had to use another jack to lift the truck to get it out. The second time I used it the same thing happened and it will not move down at all. I find now that there is only a 60 day window for returns. Poor business model my friends. Do not buy one of these jacks.
customer_reviews.author: B. Schneider

customer_reviews.title: Great value, solid all in one lift and jack stand combo.
customer_reviews.text: A great jack for a truck or SUV, especially at the $40 price tag I paid. The bottle jack makes it easy to lift the vehicle, and it's nice to have the built in jack stand for safety's sake. Much easier and safer to use than the ridiculous scissor jacks that are sold with most vehicles. The only things that could be improved in my opinion are minor: 1) a longer handle would be great, and 2) would like a little finer control in the release valve when it's time to lower the vehicle. When it finally releases, the vehicle comes down fairly quickly, rather than a gradual, slow, controlled lowering.
customer_reviews.author: Bern

customer_reviews.title: Pair of unretractable jacks, just lift car with hands to put on it!
customer_reviews.text: Tried it today first time , went up but won t go down. Now what? Second one is doing the same. Saw instructions about calling customer service, instead removed the release valve , sat on fully extended jack with wood plank to lower it, still won t go down, now I have two fully extended jacks that doesn’t go down. Glad tried it without car fist time , otherwise These people really need to pay attention to quality. For future buyers., keep scrolling , Donnt waste money time and peace of your mind for this junk. Missed return window by 10 days . HappybirthdY to me.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: The Jack in the down position is too tall, even for my full size SUV.
customer_reviews.text: I can understand that they won't fit under my Roadster but they don't even fit under the frame or lower control arms of my Toyota Sequoia? I hoped that they would allow me to jack up / lock up (in one step) to save me from using a separate jack and jack stands but they don't work for my intended purpose because they are too tall in the lowest position? They do seem of be of typical "overseas" quality. I'll use them to jack up my camping trailer when I need (rarely) to get under it to work on it.
customer_reviews.author: Gunner Hellstorm

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works perfectly on my truck with 35” tires and 6” lift
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not as strong as it claims.
customer_reviews.text: I was very excited to use this jack. I had a flat yesterday, and I positioned the jack under my truck. The jack would raise up as I pumped it, but wasn't strong enough to lift my F150. So now I have a jack that I can't use because it isn't strong enough. It's a 2014 F150, which is approximately 5,000lbs. Theoretically, this jack should be able to lift the entire truck. Useless junk.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Check the height carefully.
customer_reviews.text: It is too tall to fit under my Ford Explorer. I had to get creative and put a piece of 4X6 wood beam I had laying around to lift the tire I had to work on by driving over it slowly and carefully. Then only I could fit the jack under the lifting point. It sure does an excellent job of staying put while you are working. I even left it for 3 hours jacked up, while I went to get some parts.
customer_reviews.author: Amazonian

customer_reviews.title: Great idea and works well so far
customer_reviews.text: This Jack is a very cool idea having a bottle jack and jack stand built into one product. I'm not usually a fan of two things in one product as when one wears out the other is usually useless and that could still be the case with this but it makes things very easy not to have to jack up a car and then look for another place to put the jack stand and then lower the car down on the jack stand. Great idea and so far a great product. Note, I'm a harry homeowner and not a professional mechanic so no clue how it would hold up with more use.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Samford

customer_reviews.title: Some time later
customer_reviews.text: I actually believe these to be one of the best tools I have purchased. One point of the build quality I admire is the flat steel bottom. The jack stands do not sink into the ground. They are a little tall for regular/small vehicles but once you jack the automobile up high enough then the jack stands take over. I actually have my ECHO under two of them right now. I replaced some suspension parts and will mount two tires in the morning. I recommend that you purchase these. And I love the locking mechanism. I have no cons to list.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great All-In-One Jackstand Jack Combo
customer_reviews.text: There was a small bit of oil staining inside the box, but otherwise, it arrived fine. I'm using this to replace the jack in my Z71 which has oversized tires. It has a large jack height range and seems very sturdy. The bottom is a solid plate which makes use in dirt or sand possible. I am considering ordering a second and putting away my floor jack. My complaint is lowering the bottle jack. Without weight of a vehicle, it requires quite a bit of strength to lower.
customer_reviews.author: jamieFL

customer_reviews.title: Is This a Jack or an Experiment on Following Instructions
customer_reviews.text: If given a choice, I would not buy this jack. It requires too much attention when using it and distracts from concentration of project being worked on. It is perfect if working in a laboratory, but if you’re in the trenches, takes too much time fidgeting with the gadgets. Keep it simple. Grown men don’t need all the intended “for your safety” features.
customer_reviews.author: Michael A. Ross

customer_reviews.title: I would not buy. This jack is a failure.
customer_reviews.text: Would not recommend. I used this jack 1 time , it was a fail. Would not release - with weight on it. Because of medical events, I didn’t open the jack in time to return to Amazon. I contacted the Manufacture Their answers were of no help. The product is poor quality and the quality of the PowerBuilt company even worse.
customer_reviews.author: MyStuff

customer_reviews.title: Total lifesaver!!!!
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to use. I have a car and jeep. These fit under the jeep and I can work on it so easy. My car I want high so I can work on it so I use my 3 ton to jack up the front then use these to jack it up very high. It's like having my own lift in my garage. Better than ramps so I can work on breaks and replace ball joints. Must have for car or truck. Diy necessary!!!
customer_reviews.author: Shawn Fitness

customer_reviews.title: Where have these been all my life?
customer_reviews.text: Love these. I have a 35' travel trailer and when I need to jack it up to do the wheel bearings, it's a pain because the frame rails are high of the ground. So I end up needing to build a platform of wood to get the bottle jacks and jack stands underneath in a small area behind the axles. With these beauties, I just need a few scraps of wood and don't have to worry about all this stuff in the way. Pump up and lock in place. So simple. Anywhere there's a tight space they are great for it alleviates needing 2 sets of equipment, etc. No complaints so far.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Great alternative for a expensive lift-jack
customer_reviews.text: I recently install a 4 post lift in my home shop, however the lift came with everything but a lift jack, when i went to purchase the lift jack i found out that they were another $1200, so i purchased this jack for an alternative to use on the jack tray that came with the lift, it works perfect for the tire changes and brake work that i do at my home shop. I purchases a second one and i am waiting for that to arrive.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Cappelli

customer_reviews.title: Its about time.
customer_reviews.text: I guess things work better the second time around. I ordered this product once already. It was a bust the first time around. However, the great customer service was right on target. I returned the first one and they replaced with a better one. It works as described and it fits and replaces my original jack. And it doesnt take up much space.
customer_reviews.author: niko harrigan

customer_reviews.title: Misleading and broke during first use
customer_reviews.text: I needed to lift my truck from the frame to work on suspension components and the stated lift height would have worked if it were accurate. The overall lift includes the already extended fork. If your using the lift fork already extended then it shouldn’t be included with the overall available lift. The bottle jack screws attaching the bottle to the jack stand sheared off and the base of jack began bending upward. I had to dismantle the safety lever on the stand just to get it removed from underneath the truck. I’ll stick with a separate bottle jack and stand method from now on.
customer_reviews.author: John Fullen

customer_reviews.title: Excellent jack for the money!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this jack, very safe, it has a wide base, and goes up to 21" which is great for a jeep, suv, or truck. The only reason I gave it a 4 star and not a 5 when you release the hydraulic to let it down it doesn't go down all the way you have to give it a stomp or a pry to get the jack down all the way.
customer_reviews.author: Gen

customer_reviews.title: Such a great idea! Very compact and works exactly as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Such a great idea! Very compact and works exactly as advertised. Saves so much trouble over having to drag out a jack and stand. Very smooth operation. There is no retainer for the pin though. I bought this for my truck. They make a 2 ton version, but it is too tall to fit under my car. I wish they made a version an inch shorter. I would buy it and throw away my other jacks.
customer_reviews.author: SAM

customer_reviews.title: Great idea
customer_reviews.text: These work great and I love them but they charge too much for them on Amazon. I found them at tractor supply for $45 after I bought these. I got these to be a replacement jack for my truck that has 33-in tires as there's no place to hook a farm jack. they work great but I wouldn't suggest for anything taller than a truck with a small lift.
customer_reviews.author: James Ross

customer_reviews.title: love them so much i ordered two more
customer_reviews.text: Perfect, lifting made easy, just used the (2) Powerbuilt 640912 All-In-One 3-Ton Bottle Jack on my sons lifted Tundra, love them so much i ordered two more so i can lift all four corners. Lifts taller than any other jacks, just slide under solid axle housing/differential or frame and start pumping, no screwing around with jack stands and get the lift you need.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: 50/50 chance of getting fully functional one
customer_reviews.text: I bought two. One worked fine. The other.... Jack doesn't decompress when you open the screw. Have to use pry bar to press Jack down and get it out from under car which is a pain because there's still pressure in it. The lock pin for adjusting the height is missing the ball and spring. Box was completely taped up so they fell out before it was boxed. The quality control is ridiculous.
customer_reviews.author: billy marsh

customer_reviews.title: I like this check so much I bought two are perfect ...
customer_reviews.text: I like this check so much I bought two are perfect for a high truck or elevated car. I didn't experience any of the hydraulic leak issues others mentioned. Although I did look carefully all around it and give it a couple tests before I put it into thorough use. I have used these about 2 months now 5 or 6 times still as nice as the first time. I did make one modification and drill one set of holes lower on the jack extension part so that it could stick up higher.
customer_reviews.author: Joel Nelson

customer_reviews.title: My  Powerbuilt 640912
customer_reviews.text: I've had this Jack since 22Jul2017. I've used this a few times and It has not worked for many months now. I will contact customer service and if nothing notable was done to fix this problem I will consider this a donot buy item.
customer_reviews.author: L. T.

customer_reviews.title: Sent me a used / opened unit
customer_reviews.text: We received in time for our trip. The box was opened before, contents were opened up (used), but I tested it and didn't have any issues. Reasons why we use over the "fancier hi-lift" 1. Lifted truck (8") 2. Safer 3. More compact 4. Versatile
customer_reviews.author: Whispering Barrels

customer_reviews.title: Great Idea and Convenience. Arrived Dented though....
customer_reviews.text: Although the shipping package was undamaged, the item enclosed was. It is still usable, but it was disappointing to open it up to find the base with a bad dent on the corner. The box was obviously dropped before being placed in it's shipping box. Still, it functions as described and it a great idea. It will have a permanent home in my truck. Sure beats carrying a jack AND jack stands!
customer_reviews.author: Light-Zone

customer_reviews.title: Very functional
customer_reviews.text: It works well. You need to follow instructions for air purging/priming prior to use. Lubricate the movable jack square post to prevent binding during lowering/unloading. Ensure to unload jack latch prior to lowering by cranking up hydraulic bottle to unload the latching pin.
customer_reviews.author: The Engineer!

customer_reviews.title: Buy it.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great. I have a '99 4Runner SR5 and live on a hill with Just dirt for a driveway and needed to change my brakes. For me, a floorjack wasn't going to work. This was the answer. Jack it up, no need to slide in a stand, it's built in. Small enough to store in the back in case of flat tire. I'm kinda sad I just got new tires, but I feel an early oil change coming on!
customer_reviews.author: Matt & Charlie

customer_reviews.title: Lousy jack
customer_reviews.text: I had to use this once and it did not perform well at all. It's reach wasn't high enough and it was very very difficult to jack once the jack had the full load. I'd return it if I could but I can't. I recommend that you look elsewhere for a jack.
customer_reviews.author: teejaym

customer_reviews.title: Second time use in 13 months, almost broke
customer_reviews.text: I did leave a 5 star review right after I purchased it and used once in Dec 2018. After 13 months, I used it for the second time to jack up my 7000lbs trailer. After supporting the weight, the hydraulic cylinder is not straight up and the whole section got loose. I have no confident to use it for more jobs as it may cause injury. Sadly it just passed the 1 year warranty and I can not return it. Hope the manufacturer could improve the quality of the unit.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond

customer_reviews.title: Great for lifted or leveled 4x4s
customer_reviews.text: Works as described and is very sturdy. Its tough built and hasn't failed me yet on any of my projects or repairs. **UPDATE**02/26/15 I now have two of these. These are the best for leveled or lifted F150s they work great and with the Locking catch. You cant beat the reliability with that safety feature. I recently redid my entire suspension joints and struts, etc. Truck was lifted by two and they held perfectly even when torquing down 250# on bolts. The newer version of these don't have the 'double peg' design for the lowering lever. Instead the new ones have a flat bar and use a crimped end for tightening and loosening. Does not effect the jacks abilities.
customer_reviews.author: Midgardexplorer

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: For this being the 3rd best bottle jack on here, I'm extremely disappointed. I had this piece of crap delivered to me because my bottle. When I lifted it and tried to lower it, it never lowered. The next thing I noticed, the hydraulic fluid began leaking out. $62 for this? Are you serious? How is this still being marketed on here??? Get rid of this.
customer_reviews.author: Trevon Barnes

customer_reviews.title: Worthless piece of crap
customer_reviews.text: The profile of the jack is too tall. I could get it under the jack points of my van or trailer. When I tried to jack it up in a different place on my trailer, I could not jack it high enough. When tried to get it out, the release bar was jammed. I called the customer service number, a technician supposed to call me back to help me and never did. I had to go the auto parts store and buy a heavy duty floor jack to lift to trailer high enough to get this piece of crap out. You have been warned.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew M. Watson

customer_reviews.title: Great Jack - safest on the market!
customer_reviews.text: I love this jack. It's a jack/safety stand, all in one. It's a little heaving but - it flat works great and is the safest you could use - as it's a jack & safety stand, all in one (people should, but don't use safety stands as often as they should - it's human nature . . . this takes the concern out of the equation. An excellent jack, work the money.
customer_reviews.author: Max C. Moore

customer_reviews.title: very good jack and jack stand
customer_reviews.text: If you work on trucks and need a good jack to lift the wheel to change it or brake job this is the jack for you. Not only does it lift the truck but has a locking system to maintain the height as long as you want. Because of the closed height it in my opinion is hard to place in the lift areas of the car.
customer_reviews.author: James Babeshoff

customer_reviews.title: Taller than factory jack, works well
customer_reviews.text: Pretty good. Bought for my Tacoma with larger tires/wheels on it, this resulted in my factory jack not being tall enough to lift the truck. This reaches easily and is very sturdy. It's obviously larger than a standard jack, but I have an X-cab so it stows relatively easy. Happy with my purchase, if you have a similar need you will likely be happy with it too.
customer_reviews.author: Brian C. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Great Value for combination jack and stand
customer_reviews.text: This isn't a professional jack to be used 6 days a week in an automotive shop. It's not designed for that, but it's perfect for the weekend warrior that needs to change a tire, replace shocks or some other repair and do it safely. So for the money, it's a great combo jack and stand with a very wide and stable base.
customer_reviews.author: MLayman

customer_reviews.title: it worked fine. I checked out reviews and noticed that this ...
customer_reviews.text: After using a jack to get a full trailer off of the car hitch I could not release it and lower. My neighbor brought over the floor jack which worked to get my new Jack freed up.Then his Jack also would not release. The second time I used this Jack, to free up the floor jack, it worked fine. I checked out reviews and noticed that this was not an uncommon problem.
customer_reviews.author: Kazap

customer_reviews.title: Awesome jack
customer_reviews.text: Was looking at High Lifts for my 4x4's Came across these and decided to give them a try. Glad I did, these jacks are great. Take up less room than High Lift. Cost less also. Liked it so much I bought 3 of them.
customer_reviews.author: nailer

customer_reviews.title: Too tall for my cars
customer_reviews.text: I like the concept of this jack, but the first time I tried to use it I realized that it's way too tall for both of my cars. I have to jack the car way up with my floor jack before I can slip this jack underneath. It will probably work OK with my pickup truck.
customer_reviews.author: Holly's Dad

customer_reviews.title: Love this
customer_reviews.text: Took a minute to figure this item out since I didn't read the directions lol. At first it wouldn't get my 4Runner off the ground till I lowered it back down and seen that the pin pulls out to lift the support up to closer height and then used the bottle jack part. I will be purchasing another or even more before to long.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Chambers

customer_reviews.title: This Jack and Jackstand combo is the best idea ever.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this a week ago in support of my Ford F150 2015. I was doing my front and rear brakes/rotors an wanted a better jack to carry in my truck instead of the factory model. This item works great. I just ordered another one to do my rear breaks. I am taking back the stand alone jack stands I bought to support my truck. You do not need them, as this combination jack and jack stand is all you will ever need. I had no issues with it and I have 20 inch rims.
customer_reviews.author: Preston Maseda

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Mine has worked for me so far. Have used it several times for a heavy vehicle and it's not failed me yet. Like most bottle jacks it's pretty tall so it won't work with cars. If you've got a big van or truck it works great. You can also just use it as a jack stand if you've already got your car jacked up.
customer_reviews.author: K. Steffy

customer_reviews.title: Leaked fluid on first use
customer_reviews.text: I used this jack on my little utility trailer. It went up easy as expected, but got stuck coming down and just started to leak fluid. I had to use another jack to lift trailer so I could remove this one. Features are nice, and it looks good, but just does not function. Look for something different.
customer_reviews.author: SmithBasin

customer_reviews.title: THE solution for trucks, SUVs and trailers!!!
customer_reviews.text: Works great with my Silverado, Mercedes and motorcycle hauler trailer. BEST OF ALL, it isn't likely to let your vehicle or trailer shift and come crashing down on you or damage anything.
customer_reviews.author: okimar

customer_reviews.title: Just got it today and tried to use it. Doesn't lower turning the knob like it should.
customer_reviews.text: It raises fine but will not lower. The only way to get it to lower is completely remove the hydraulic screw and have all the hydraulic fluid shoot out of it... Which in turn means I have to refill it every time. It was pre-used, whole box covered in tape, rods not covered in paper and in worn condition. Thanks... DO NOT BUY! Fresh out of the box it will not raise my truck. It will not hold anything above 200 pounds. Been trying to get it to work for 2 days with no avail. Waste of $40!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Piece of garbage, as are all things made in China!
customer_reviews.text: This item is a piece of s*@t!!!! Defective! Cylinder would not retract as designed/advertised, when it finally did, oil sprayed from the air vent nozzle all over the floor. Anything made in China should come with a warning label! If I could give this a negative rating I would!!!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: David DeBonville

customer_reviews.title: Best jack stand and jack you can get
customer_reviews.text: This is almost the same size as my standard jack stands, but the built in hydrolic jack makes this the coolest one I have ever had. This is also made very strong and way better then the 50 dollar standard jack stands I have had for years.
customer_reviews.author: Russel R.

customer_reviews.title: better than a bottle jack
customer_reviews.text: good price, good product, like the added safety of the jack locking bought 2 to supplement the 4 floor jacks in the shop. once you remember to release the safety catch, you will love this item. really an improvement over any bottle jack and almost better than floor jacks....once you remember to release the safety catch!
customer_reviews.author: blacklisted

customer_reviews.title: Good jack, bad handle.
customer_reviews.text: Quick and easy to lift Ford Explorer. Too tall to jack a Sorento that is lower to ground. Even with my Sorento, I use it as just a jack stand. Only part I don't like is the rod you use pump and release with, it is not as sturdy as I would like, the end will bend out of shape if you are not carefully. Dont ask how I know.
customer_reviews.author: Hos

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Couldn't ask for a better product jack and kick stand in one.high quality made and very durable. Locks perfectly and won't have to worry about slipping.
customer_reviews.author: leonard forbes

customer_reviews.title: Jack with Built-in Stand!
customer_reviews.text: I like that this jack also has the built-in stand. It functions as listed. The drawbacks for me are the lift distance and the minimum clearance. The lift distance is just a wee bit too small. The minimum clearance is fine for my vehicle with fully inflated tires. If a tire is low/flat, I will not be able to get the jack in a position to lift the vehicle.
customer_reviews.author: Sidious

customer_reviews.title: Bent !!
customer_reviews.text: Came out of box bent , no damage to box . Guess try take a big hammer to it , sad have to do it , other than that seems like a good product.
customer_reviews.author: Rob B.

customer_reviews.title: Functionally perfect at delivery.  No problems after many uses.
customer_reviews.text: The jack stand works perfectly with my GMC Terrain when placed at the recommended jacking points around the vehicle. The support plate at the top of the stand is dimensionally right and does not deform the pinch-weld or damage the adjacent chassis. Pumping the bottle jack is easy and predictable. Note: The automatic locking feature of the stand works well once some of the paint at the friction-points wears. The jack and stand are now consistently working together exactly as described by Powerbuilt. I couldn't be happier with the purchase. This jack stand was a bargain, and I feel safe using it.
customer_reviews.author: Wiley

customer_reviews.title: headline
customer_reviews.text: just used couple hours ago so new when I released pressure for jack to come down it didn't go down far enough to release vehicle like I said its brand new first time used after a couple of uses it will more then likely work great liked the concept and jack held vehicle with no problems didn't have to search for jack stand
customer_reviews.author: Rick Jones

customer_reviews.title: I buy a used, but work very well. I like this so much.
customer_reviews.text: The product I got was used, still working great, not a problem yet. It's great to see a company think outside the box and put great ideals all in one. It's saved me a lot of time. I don't know if the new one have the "little problem" that you need to push a little hard (you need to put your foot and then push the cylinder) to get this down. Nothing special, but a little problem if you wish to down speedly. With this, you almost need to have a little bottle jack, just if your vehicle is not to tall, because its minimum height it's a little big almost for a chevrolet blazer '95.
customer_reviews.author: gameoso

customer_reviews.title: Am I lucky? None of the issues others have had.
customer_reviews.text: I was sceptical after reading some of the reviews but decided to go ahead and try them out. After reading instructions and figuring them out I decided to try them out I put them to work on my F250. I felt completely safe to go under the truck and even have someone sit in driver seat without any issues. So, maybe I am lucky and got two of them without issues but they work great for my needs. Only thing I wish was better was I wish the handle was longer and was one solid piece. The two handles don't stay connected very well.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Moller

customer_reviews.title: Very stable, high-lifting jack.  Not so useful as a stand on its own due to fixed notch positions.
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised, I really like the vertical lift and very stable base. Good for general Jeep work, lifts higher than most floor jacks. You really have to push down the post to get it to descend when turning the release valve. That makes it a bit safer, actually. One functional disappointment: It is advertised to be lockable so you can work without adding a stand. However, you usually end up jacking something to a specific height for your repair, and it never is where any of the the locking notches are located. Not a huge problem, just a let down.
customer_reviews.author: jtflag

customer_reviews.title: Replaced my vehicle jack with this and probably all my jacks...
customer_reviews.text: It was everything I was looking for and needed for my vehicle. Great for SUV and Trucks not for low vehicles, lighter than expected no more floor jacks in my Truck. Made a flat tire easy to change on the side of the road and didn't sink in the sand like my floor jack did all the time. Very happy with this product a must but if you don't already have one.
customer_reviews.author: Samuel P Green

customer_reviews.title: Very happy
customer_reviews.text: Great idea. I have a 84 Ford F-250 4wd. Most Jacks are too low and unstable to be of any use for me. this one is perfect. I actually used it to jacked the engine up so I could easily remove the oil cooler for a new gasket. The wide base and locking jack stand feature made me confident I would be safe.
customer_reviews.author: Freedom

customer_reviews.title: Great SAFE Jack!
customer_reviews.text: Love this sturdy, safe jack under my 2007 Ford Expedition. Being stout, it is heavy to tote around, but the backup anti-slip feature gives me confidence that I am safe when I am under a corner of my 3 ton truck.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Johnston

customer_reviews.title: Works very well on 1500 Dodge Ram
customer_reviews.text: I have used this for extended lift (>2 weeks) while ordering various parts for a 2nd gen Dodge Ram 1500. Jacks easily, holds as it should. The large plate platform helps prevent chipping and "sinking" of the jack stand into gravel and pavement surfaces.
customer_reviews.author: A. Deskins

customer_reviews.title: Works great for me
customer_reviews.text: This thing is cool, and I feel it is very secure. Lifted my vehicle up with no issues, and then locked the bar so it won't fail, no matter what. A little on the large size to carry around, but all things considered, I have had no issues with it. Typical twist for the valve, have not yet had any issues with it.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Thus far it has served me well multiple times. It doesn’t look or feel very strong however it lifted my truck with out a problem and it had the power to with two tires off the ground no matter the side it was placed on. The base is flat and good for off-road use or in snow.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: Won't hold pressure don't buy
customer_reviews.text: Didn't even get to use this once, when I tried to lift up the side of a Jeep JK stock it wouldn't hold pressure and would drop under load
customer_reviews.author: Will

customer_reviews.title: Works amazing.
customer_reviews.text: Stands a little tall for my 99 chevy blazer so i have to use a jack at first but soon as i get it under it jacks up nicely and effortlessly has a failsafe lock easy to engage. Instructions easy to use. Showed up in perfect working order.
customer_reviews.author: daniel

customer_reviews.title: Worth the money!
customer_reviews.text: Big big BIG help! My fiancé is redoing the entire front end to his truck and I’ve ordered 2 of these bad boys. Such life savers! He’s had his truck jacked up on 2 of these for a little over a month straight now and they’ve not give out yet!
customer_reviews.author: Shana sadler

customer_reviews.title: Used to be a great deal when they were only $35.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. Big time saver. More room to work under the vehicle without a jack in the way. I paid $35 and was very happy. Came back here a year later to buy a second one and now they're $54. Pretty annoying. They're nice, but not that nice. Deduct one star for jacking the price.
customer_reviews.author: Billy Dickbags

customer_reviews.title: Too Tall up go under most all vehicles.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my 3/4 pickup for flat tires. Well found out the hard way that this jack/stand is too tall to go under the axle. If you put under the frame or leaf spring then it won't jack up high enough to put new aired up tire on.
customer_reviews.author: Dee

customer_reviews.title: I was charged twice, weak connection on handle
customer_reviews.text: Handle connection is very weak, it disconnects easy, I payed over 64 uds I was charged twice for the same product. A friend find the same exact jack for less then 35 dls. Do your research before you are being robe from your money
customer_reviews.author: David, C.

customer_reviews.title: Its junk, and can't return it,  and it's only been 32 days.
customer_reviews.text: Piece of junk, wouldn't even fit under my SUV, when I did get it under it, it would only jack up so high, and it keep going down slowly, you could hear the air . Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Gerald Walker

customer_reviews.title: Almost perfect
customer_reviews.text: It is what you would expect. No leaky hyd. Fluid like the other reviewers. Would def buy again. Only drawback & it’s a SMALL one and to be expected, is that the jack is a little heavy/cumbersome. Although, you cannot beat the price though!
customer_reviews.author: dre (NJ)

customer_reviews.title: Great jack
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome jack. It arrived in a very timely matter. I was having issues with my built in jacks on my 5th wheel trailer. This arrived just as the repairman showed up to help. He forgot his jack. We used this to jack up a corner of the trailer and it works flawlessly. Thanks Amazon for having such great products and timely delivery.
customer_reviews.author: DB

customer_reviews.title: This jack was perfect to do work under it
customer_reviews.text: My husband does most of the work on our vehicles. Over the years, I cannot begin to count how much we've saved. I have a jeep that is decked out for off-roading. This jack was perfect to do work under it. It felt secure and was easy to handle. I'd recommend buying two than risking it with one. My husband wishes he got this sooner than later. He loves it!
customer_reviews.author: PharmDMom

product_meta.title: Powerbuilt Alltrade 640912 Black 3 Ton, All-in-One Bottle Jack
feature_bullets: Dimensions: 9.75"L x 9.75"W x 12.25"H. Patented design combines jack stand and bottle jack in one unit
Safety bar locks unit at desired height. This jack is for trucks and off road type vehicles
Portable jack designed to safely Lift and hold both Regular and unibody cars and trucks
Highly durable. Wide steel base for stability under load. Height range is 11 inch to 21 inch, but its default lift range is 11 to 17.25 inch, it can be raised to 21 inch if adjusted manually
Strong safety bar keeps jack from lowering once it has been raised to maximum height

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.4 out of 5 stars1,449 ratings4.4 out of 5 stars
specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
